item.title: Reversing Stories - MalwareTech Challenge #2
item.description: Windows Reversing # Strings2.exe # Hello friend, back again with the MalwareTech Windows reversing challenge, now we are given a PE file named strings2.exe_. Same as the previous challenge, we can only use static analysis to solve this challenge. The description of this challenge: strings2.exe contains an un-encrypted flag stored within the executable. When run, the program will output an MD5 hash of the flag but not the original.

item.title: Reversing Stories - MalwareTech Challenge #1
item.description: Windows Reversing # Strings1.exe # Hello friend, in this challenge we are given a PE file named strings1.exe_ . The rule of this challenge is that we can only use static analysis to solve it, that’s why there is “_” at the end of the PE file name, which is to prevent us from accidentally running it. The description of this challenge: strings1.exe contains an un-encrypted flag stored within the executable.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, i’m Irfan Alditya. A software reverse engineering hobbyist. Find me on twitter @aldityairfan
